metadata.name: Potential Credential Dumping Via WER
metadata.comment: Detects potential credential dumping via Windows Error Reporting LSASS Shtinkering technique which uses the Windows Error Reporting to dump lsass

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\werfault.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('werfault.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.parent_process.session.issuer), lower('authori')) OR contains(lower(process.parent_process.session.issuer), lower('autori'))) AND (contains(lower(actor.user.name), lower('authori')) OR contains(lower(actor.user.name), lower('autori'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -u -p ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -ip ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -s ')) AND NOT lower(process.parent_process.name) = lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\lsass.exe'))

output.summary: Detects potential credential dumping via Windows Error Reporting LSASS Shtinkering technique which uses the Windows Error Reporting to dump lsass

metadata.objective: False positive: Windows Error Reporting might produce similar behavior. In that case, check the PID associated with the "-p" parameter in the CommandLine. References: https://github.com/deepinstinct/Lsass-Shtinkering, https://media.defcon.org/DEF%20CON%2030/DEF%20CON%2030%20presentations/Asaf%20Gilboa%20-%20LSASS%20Shtinkering%20Abusing%20Windows%20Error%20Reporting%20to%20Dump%20LSASS.pdf
